III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth punched and kicked another youth several times yesterday.
One youth has a bruise on their leg and was given medication for
the pain. The youth feels safe.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A/ Complaint Source was interviewed face to face at the
facility on February 26, 2024. Youth A reported she called the CPS
hotline because she was concerned Youth B was going to press
charges on her after the events that occurred on February 23, 2024.
She was asked what occurred and she reported she was in a bad
mood on February 23, 2024, and had increased hyperactivity. Youth
A reported she was being rough with Staff 1 and was trying to rough
house with her. She reported Staff 1 continued to try to verbally de-
escalate her. Youth A reported Youth B came up and kicked her in
the left leg near her ankle and grabbed her arm to stop her. She
reported there was staff right there, but it was a quick move. Youth A
showed this consultant her ankle which had a mark on it, and she
stated she met with the nurse about it. Youth A reported because
Youth B assaulted her, she wanted to assault him back. She reported
when Youth B walked away from her after kicking her, she tried to
run up and punch him. Youth A reported Staff 2 and Staff 3 got in the
way, and she started to assault them. She reported when she
assaulted Staff 2 and Staff 3, Youth B came up and punched her too.
Youth A reported Youth B was taken away from the area but heard
he wanted to press charges against him. She reported she does not
know what pressing charges mean but she does not want that to
happen, so she called the CPS hotline to report it. Youth A reported
staff were doing their job the best they could and knew that she
should not be assaulting them. She stated she is not taking her
medication which increases her anger, because she doesn’t like
2

them. Youth A reported none of the staff horse-played with the youth
and on February 23, 2024, she was the one trying to push Staff 1.
She reported staff are keeping her and Youth B separated.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
26, 2024. Youth B reported he is sick of being at the facility and
wants to be away from Youth A. When asked what happened on
February 23, 2024, he reported all he remembers is Youth A coming
up to him and punching him. He reported he did not do anything to
provoke Youth A and noted she wanted to date him, but he told her
no. Youth B reported he tried to walk away from her, but she kept
running up to him saying she was going to hurt him. He reported he
never kicked Youth A. Youth B reported he did try to push her off him
with one of his hands to her chest, trying to keep her away. He
reported Staff 2 and Staff 3 were present for the situation trying to
keep Youth A away. Youth B reported Youth A attacked both Staff 2
and Staff 3. He reported he does not remember seeing any other
youth on the unit. Youth B reported Staff 3 was able to get him into
the sensory room away from Youth A. He reported staff were all
doing their job well and Youth A was aggressive towards everyone.
Youth B reported he has never seen a staff member rough house
with a youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on March 1, 2024. On February
23, 2024, Staff 1 reported she had to redirect Youth A several times
because she continued to try to hug Staff 1 and did not give
appropriate boundary spacing. She reported when she was giving
Youth A verbal redirection several times, Youth B had walked up and
told Youth A she needed to respect space. Staff 1 reported Youth A
reported Youth B had kicked her in her leg when he walked up to her,
but Staff 1 did not see this occur. She reported Youth B had walked
away from the situation and was going to the sensory room. She
reported Youth A reported to her she wanted to assault Youth B
because he hurt her, and Staff 1 attempted to verbally de-escalate
Youth A. Staff 1 reported Youth A went over towards the sensory
room and Staff 2 and Staff 3 were blocking Youth A with their bodies.
She reported she witnessed Youth A begin to hit Staff 3. Staff 1
continued to verbally redirect her, and Youth A walked towards Staff
1. She reported Youth B then came out of the sensory room and
fought with Youth A. Staff 1 reported a “code green” was called to
help de-escalate the situation, and Staff 2 and Staff 3 were able to
separate the two youths. She reported no other youths were in the
milieu to witness the situation. Staff 1 reported she is trained as
direct care staff to continue to verbally redirect the youth when they
are not being appropriate. A restraint should only occur in an
emergency situation. She reported a “code green” gets called to
bring in additional support into the unit. Staff 1 reported she is trained
3

to maintain appropriate and professional boundaries which tells them
not to horseplay with the youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on March 4, 2024. Staff 2
reported she was working on February 23, 2024. She stated Youth A
was trying to hang on Staff 1 and was verbally redirected by Staff 1
and Staff 2 to give personal space. Youth A would not listen to verbal
redirect and just continued to state she was giving Staff 1 a hug.
Youth B did not like what Youth A was doing and told her she needed
to stop and respect the staff. Youth A told Youth B it was none of his
business. Youth B then kicked Youth A in the leg and Staff 2 reported
she redirected him to leave the situation alone. Staff 2 reported Staff
3 got between the two youths to get them to move to other areas of
the unit. Youth A slapped Staff 2 for getting in her way to get Youth
B. Staff 2 continued to verbally redirect the situation. Youth B ran
after Youth A because she hit Staff 3. Youth A and Youth B got into a
fight with one another. Staff 2 reported she called a “code green”.
She reported Youth B was able to go into the sensory room, per his
request, to separate from Youth A. Staff 2 reported Nurse came to
the unit to look over both youth. She reported the situation was
handled appropriately. Staff are trained to use verbal redirection and
to call a “code green” when there is a safety concern. Staff 2 reported
none of the staff horseplay with the youth and everyone maintains
professional boundaries.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on February 28, 2024. Staff 3
reported on February 23, 2024, Youth A was having inappropriate
boundaries with Staff 1. He reported Youth A tried to hug, touch, and
lick Staff 1 numerous times and was verbally redirected each time by
him and Staff 1. Staff 3 reported the youth must be reminded
frequently to respect personal boundaries. He reported Youth B gets
upset when staff are not respected by youth at the facility. Staff 3
reported Youth B told Youth A to stop touching Staff 1. He reported
Youth B kicked Youth A on the leg and then walked away. Staff 3
reported he and Staff 2 kept space between the two youths by
standing in between the two youths. He reported Youth B had asked
to go to the sensory room to get away from Youth A. He reported he
let Youth B into the room, and he was very calm. Youth A tried to get
to Youth B and slapped Staff 3 in the face. Staff 3 reported Youth B
got upset and charged at Youth A. He reported staff attempted to
remain in between the youth and a code status was called. Staff 3
reported Youth A continued to assault the staff to get to Youth B.
Staff separated the youth by blocking and verbally redirecting them to
go into a different area. Both youths went to meet with the nursing
staff. Staff 3 reported he has no concerns about staff horseplaying
with youth or not handling a situation appropriately for de-escalation.
He reported regarding this situation everyone responded immediately
and was able to keep the youth separated.
4

Chief Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility
on February 26, 2025. Chief Administrator reported he was aware of
concerns about Youth A assaulting multiple staff members on
February 23, 2024. He reported Youth A was upset in the morning
because she found out that she gained weight. Chief Administrator
reported Youth A has also not been medication compliant which
leads to increased violent behavior. He reported Youth B can be
protective of the staff and does not like when other youth are not
following the rules. Chief Administrator reported staff are keeping
both Youth A and Youth B separated as much as possible.
Law Enforcement was interviewed via phone on March 3, 2025.
Law Enforcement reported he will be closing out his case as it
pertains to this investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility Incident report for Youth A dated 02/23/2024- This
incident report was completed by Staff 2. This incident report
was consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
- Facility Incident report for Youth B dated 02/23/2024- This
incident report was completed by Staff 2. This incident report
was consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
- Nursing Report dated 02/23/2024 for Youth A- Youth A met
with Nurse post the incident. Nurse noted Youth A had a
scratch on inner left calf from peer kicking her, superficial from
a shoe. Youth A stated she was hit in the head by Youth B as
well but there was no swelling or bruise. Youth A refused any
medication and stated that she was “fine”.
- Nursing Report dated 02/23/2024 for Youth B- Youth B told
Nurse he had no medical concerns at this time.
- Standards for Staff-Client Relationships Facility Policy
dated 06/2022- Staff members are expected to maintain a
professional relationship with persons served. Any
relationship with a preserve served that is non-professional in
nature is not acceptable. This also means staff cannot
horseplay with youth.
- Behavior Management/ Restraint Facility Policy dated
06/2023- This policy notes staff are to use the less restrictive
measures when there is escalated behaviors. Staff should
offer options/ coping skills, offer other spaces the youth can
go to, and utilize behavioral momentum.
- Code Green/Emergency Assistance Policy dated 06/2023-
This policy notes that staff will determine the necessity of
initiating a Code Green/ Emergency Assistance call. A Code
5

Green is a signal to other Pine Rest Staff that additional
assistance is needed in the area.
- Human Resource File for Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3- Staff
1, Staff 2, and Staff 3’s human resource files were reviewed.
None of the staff had any disciplinary actions noted within in
their file. Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 are all up to date on
required trainings. Staff 1 completed Residential Role of
Direct Care Worker on 12/27/2023 and behavior management
training on 12/28/2023. Staff 2 completed Residential Role of
Direct Care Worker on 11/20/2023 and behavior management
training on 11/09/2023 Staff 3 completed Residential Role of
Direct Care Worker on 02/19/2024 and behavior management
training on 02/1/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with following their behavior
management policy and staff relations policy. There was no
evidence finding of horseplay of staff with the youth. All proper
protocols were taken in this situation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
